column15: [City, State] residents trust WM to deliver residential trash and recycling services that are unmatched for reliability and sustainability.
column18: WM has a variety of waste services available throughout most of the [City, State] area. As one of [State]'s largest trash and recycling service partners, we pride ourselves on providing exceptional customer service and environmental stewardship within the local community. When you choose WM, we don't just become your waste services provider, we become your partner in sustainability.
column44: If a holiday falls on a weekday, collections for the rest of the week will be pushed back a day. For example, for a Thursday holiday, service would be on Friday, and Friday service would be Saturday. For holidays on Saturday or Sunday, there are no delays.
column47: WM provides a 96 gallon cart for weekly trash collection. To view your specific service day, please click here, enter your address and select “Verify”.
column49: Place container on the street with wheels against the curb the night before the collection day and remove after the collection. Keep container at least three (3) feet from parked cars, mailboxes, and other obstacles that may prevent WM team members from picking it up.
column51: All trash should be bagged. Do not overfill your container – the lid must close tightly. Overflow and materials outside may be subject to additional charge or will not be collected.
column53:
Acceptable items include standard household trash like food waste, chip bags, paper towels, plastic bags, and textiles (donate if lightly used).

Non-acceptable items include construction waste, auto parts, tires, household hazardous waste (paint, oil, household cleaners), medical or electronic waste.
column55: Sign up for new service online, any time by entering your address in the “Set Up Your Service” section above.
column57:
Did you know you can get updates on your service ETA by signing up or logging in to your My WM account? If containers were curbside by the specified time and were not emptied, you can also report a missed pickup online. On the main dashboard, locate the services card. Click details on current service to submit your missed pickup request.

Missed pickups cannot be scheduled if your container was not out or was blocked at the time of service and must be reported within five (5) days. Visit our support article for more details.
column59: Additional carts are available for a fee. Click here to request help with changes to your services.
column60: Request a Container Repair or Replacement
column61:
Sign up or log in to your My WM account. Locate the appropriate service card (trash, recycling, organics, etc.) on the main dashboard and select “Container Issue” and follow the prompts to submit.

Questions? Unable to submit your request? Please scroll to the bottom of the support article to Request Help.
column68: WM provides a 96 gallon cart for every other week recycling collection. To view your specific service day, please click here, enter your address and select “Verify.”
column70: Place container on the street with wheels against the curb the night before the collection day and removed on the collection day. Keep container at least three (3) feet from parked cars, mailboxes, and other obstacles that may prevent WM team members from picking it up.
column72: Recycle clean and dry bottles, cans, paper, and cardboard. Break down cardboard boxes to keep them from getting stuck in your container. Glass is not accepted. Do not place plastic bags or liners in your container (local recycling drop-off programs for bags may be available). Visit Recycle Right® for more information on recycling.
column74: Empty loose recyclables directly into your container. No loose plastic bags and never bag your recyclables. Do not overfill your container – the lid must close tightly. Contaminated materials or overflow may be subject to an additional charge, or not collected. Looking for more information on how to set up a successful recycling system in your home? Visit Recycle Right® for step-by-step instructions, downloadable container labels, and more.
column76: Contamination occurs when non-acceptable items are placed in your container. To avoid potential contamination charges or non-collection, and to ensure your recyclables have a chance at becoming new products, it’s important that only the right items make their way into your recycling. Learn more about how you can reduce contamination at Recycle Right® wm.com/recycleright.
column78: Sign up for new service online, any time by entering your address in the “Set Up Your Service” section above.
column80:

Missed pickups cannot be scheduled if your container was not out or was blocked at the time of service and must be reported within five (5) days. Visit our support article for more details.
column82: Additional carts are available. Click here to request help with changes to your services.
column83: Request a Container Repair or Replacement
column84:
Sign up or log in to your My WM account. Locate the appropriate service card (trash, recycling, organics, etc.) on the main dashboard and select “Container Issue” and follow the prompts to submit.

Questions? Unable to submit your request? Please scroll to the bottom of the support article to Request Help.
column89: WM offers convenient collection one time per month. This is an easy and convenient way to dispose of items too big to fit in your curbside container. Collection must be scheduled by the Friday before the collection week. Items must be at the curb Sunday night of the week of scheduled bulk pick up. Please visit our support page and enter your address to live chat or submit a request to schedule your bulk items.
column91: Acceptable items include household appliances, furniture, carpet, and televisions.
column93: Non-acceptable items include loose trash, tires, dirt, sand rock, hazardous waste, or construction and demolition waste.
column110:
WM provides qualified disabled customers with valet service at no additional charge. Drivers will assist by taking carts out to the curbside for service and will return the carts to a mutually agreed designated location. If a person who is not disabled resides with the disabled customer, the customer will not qualify for free valet service.

Non-qualified customers may request backyard service at an additional cost. To request help with valet services, please click here. Sign in to your My WM account and follow the prompts to submit a request.

column89: WM provides a 96 gallon container for weekly yard waste collection. Yard Waste will be collected from the first full week of March to second Friday after Thanksgiving. To view your specific service day, please click here, enter your address and select “Verify.”
column91: Place containers on the street with wheels against the curb the night before the collection day and removed on the collection day. Keep containers at least three feet from parked cars, mailboxes and other obstacles that may prevent WM team members from picking it up.Up to three (3) paper composting bags are acceptable as part of the weekly seasonal yard waste collection.
column93: Do not use plastic bags for yard waste – place loose yard waste directly into your container. Do not overfill your container – the lid must close tightly. No overflow allowed.
column95:
Acceptable items include grass clippings, leaves, tree branches (broken down to fit loosely in container), and brush.

Non-acceptable items include dirt, sod, stone, concrete, and rock. Do not bag yard waste – place loose into container.

column110: WM offers convenient collection of up three (3) bulk items on your regular collection day.  This is an easy and convenient way to dispose of items too big to fit in your curbside container. Collection must be scheduled at least 48 hours before your regular collection day. Please visit our support page and enter your address to live chat or submit a request to schedule your bulk items.
column112: Acceptable items include household appliances, furniture, carpet, and televisions.
column114: Non-acceptable items include loose trash, tires, dirt, sand rock, hazardous waste, or construction and demolition waste.
column131: WM provides qualified disabled customers with valet service at no additional charge. Drivers will assist by taking carts out to the curbside for service and will return the carts to a mutually agreed designated location. If a person who is not disabled resides with the disabled customer, the customer will not qualify for free valet service. To Request valet service, contact the Town of McCandless at 412-364-06160
column132: At Your Door Special Collection® Service
column133:
WM’s At Your Door Special Collection® Service provides a safe and sustainable solution for disposing of household hazardous waste, such as garden chemicals, household cleaners, paint products, electronics, and hard-to-recycle items, from the convenience of home.

For more information about acceptable materials and to schedule your home collection, please click here.
column135: Discounted service rates are available to customers xx years of age and older. Proof of age is required. Please contact the Town of McCandless at412-364-06160 for more information on how to apply.
